newsitem.title: GREECE: GREEK NATL MORTGAGE, BEAR STEARNS SIGN SECURITISATION DEAL.
newsitem.headline: GREEK NATL MORTGAGE, BEAR STEARNS SIGN SECURITISATION DEAL.

text.p: Greece's National Mortgage Bank and Bear Stearns signed a three-year loan securitisation deal on Tuesday to introduce securitisation operations in Greece.
They will cooperate on the exchange of know-how and will set up a joint venture company to securitise mortgages and other asset-backed loans.

"National Mortgage Bank president Vassilis Rapanos and Bear Stearns senior managing director and board member Peter Cherasia signed the cooperation deal which will be implemented in two phases," National Mortgage Bank said.

Securitisation will improve the bank's capital adequacy, enabling it to offer loans at a lower cost. Its assets and liabilities will be better managed while a boost is expected in the secondary market for mortgage bonds which will offer new investment opportunities, it said.
During the first eight-month phase, Bear Stearns will set up securitisation operations and procedures and advise National Mortgage on pertinent legal and regulatory matters.
Their joint venture which will first securitise National Mortgage Bank loans will expand to other types of receivables for other banks and organisations.

"The benefits securitisation brings are not limited to the issuer. International experience has shown that securitisation increases the alternative investment opportunities in a country," National Mortgage Bank said. --George Georgiopoulos, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
